name: Finland
description: Finland, the ‘Land of a Thousand Lakes’, is a Nordic nation characterized by its vast forests, numerous lakes and islands, and a unique culture shaped by its long winters and short summers. It’s known for its stunning natural beauty, including the Northern Lights, and its commitment to sustainability and outdoor activities. The country boasts a rich history, a vibrant arts scene, and a welcoming population.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Finland has a relatively small but highly educated population.
quickFacts.detail: The population density is low, contributing to the feeling of spaciousness and tranquility.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Finland is the second-largest country in the EU.
quickFacts.detail: Approximately 70% of the country is covered by forests.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Helsinki is a vibrant and cosmopolitan city.
quickFacts.detail: It’s a major center for culture, business, and technology.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: Finland has two official languages, reflecting its historical connections.
quickFacts.detail: Swedish is spoken by a minority of the population.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: Finland uses the Euro as its currency.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is largely based on forestry, metalworking, and technology.

climateData.title: Finnish Climate
climateData.description: Finland experiences a humid continental climate with long, cold winters and short, mild summers. The climate varies significantly across the country, with the northern regions experiencing more extreme conditions.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Long, dark, and cold winters with heavy snowfall. Temperatures typically range from -15°C to -5°C.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: A gradual warming with melting snow and blooming flowers. Temperatures rise from -5°C to 15°C.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Warm and sunny with long daylight hours. Temperatures typically range from 15°C to 25°C.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Cool and crisp with colorful foliage. Temperatures fall from 15°C to -5°C.

naturalWonders.name: Lake District of Finland
naturalWonders.description: Finland is renowned for its thousands of lakes, creating a stunning landscape of serene waters and surrounding forests. These lakes are a vital part of the Finnish ecosystem and offer incredible recreational opportunities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lakes vary in size from small ponds to vast bodies of water, each with its own unique character. Many are surrounded by boreal forests, creating a picturesque scene.

naturalWonders.name: Karhunkierros Trail
naturalWonders.description: The ‘Bear’s Trail’ is a popular hiking trail in Finnish Lapland, offering a challenging and rewarding experience through diverse landscapes.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The trail winds through forests, over rocky terrain, and along lakeshores, providing stunning views of the Arctic wilderness. It’s known for its wildlife viewing opportunities.
viewingTips: Keep an eye out for wildlife

naturalWonders.name: Northern Lights (Aurora Borealis)
naturalWonders.description: The Northern Lights are a spectacular display of light in the sky, visible during the winter months in Finnish Lapland.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The lights are caused by charged particles from the sun interacting with the Earth’s atmosphere. They appear in various colors, including green, pink, and purple.
viewingTips: Find a dark location away from city lights

ecosystemData.title: Boreal Forests of Finland
ecosystemData.overview: Finland is dominated by vast boreal forests, which play a crucial role in the country’s ecosystem and economy. These forests are home to a diverse range of plant and animal life.

biodiversityCategories.name: Forest Flora
biodiversityCategories.description: Finland’s forests are home to a wide variety of tree species, including spruce, pine, birch, and aspen.

statistics.details: Dominant tree species in northern Finland

biodiversityCategories.name: Birdlife
biodiversityCategories.description: Finland is a birdwatcher’s paradise, with over 200 bird species recorded in the country.

statistics.details: Finland is a key stopover point for migratory birds

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Finland
activities.description: Finland offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activities.name: Day Hike

activities.name: Multi-Day Trek
